page.title: 10FALA VILLAGE
page.content: Fala Village is in this block.The village comprises nineteen houses, a church, a school and a village hall. The hall is a corrugated iron structure,which was brought from Fife where it had been used by the military in the first World War. There is no shop in the village now, but there is a sub-post office. Although Fala is a rural area, only three men, resident in the village, work on the land. Several people commute to Edinburgh and there are ten retired people. In the village itself, there are thirteen children up to the age of sixteen. There are twenty children enrolled in the school, fifteen of whom live outwith the village. Fala Church, of the Church of Scotland, is linked with Crichton and
